page.title: 09TRACTION ENGINES
page.content: Although Steam Engines aren't used any more there are shows for them. There are a lot of preparations before the show, such as cleaning the ashpan and the boilertubes, oiling the engine and lighting the fire with diesel and pieces of rag. The coal bucket is filled with about 250kg of coal and the boiler filled with about 600 gallons of water. The trailer is hooked onto the engine, and more coal is put on the back of the trailer. The tools go on the front of the trailer. The dynamo belt is taken off and the gear cogs are oiled. At the show the engine is parked in a space so that people can see it. Sometimes the driver will play tug-o-war with the children.
